Content: [telegram] <Akijoman> Komodo is an independent blockchain. You can find info here: https://komodoplatform.com/blockchain2/ and this https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KPSD/pages/20480004/FAQ (re @Yous: Hi, I'm new and trying to understand more Komodo. If I undestand well komodo is building a network of parallel blockchains so each projects can have its own blockchain and consensus? Is each independante blockchain can be adapted to the needs depending of the project? How many TPS can have each blockchain? Thanks!)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> So Komodo, and other projects that build with it, can scale by adding additional scaling chains parallel to the main, they all act as the main chain and are fungible and secured with dPoW to one another and Bitcoin. This is using Komodos MoMoM tech. Other coins that build with Komodo can scale in the same way and are not limited to KMD itself, and can change mining algorithms, block sizes, coin amounts etc. I'm not 100% on the amount of tx/s that can be handled on each chain, but it's being worked on for a way that automatically spawns new chains as TX amount/demand increases, and each new chain secured by dPoW. I believe that last tests had 20,000 tx/s 
https://komodoplatform.com/komodo-platforms-new-scalability-tech/ (re @Yous: Hi, I'm new and trying to understand more Komodo. If I undestand well komodo is building a network of parallel blockchains so each projects can have its own blockchain and consensus? Is each independante blockchain can be adapted to the needs depending of the project? How many TPS can have each blockchain? Thanks!)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> PIRATE is a new privacy coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Pirate is a 100% private coin. It ONLY does Zk-Snark transactions, so all are invisible on blockchain but requires running a full node. It is a coin built from Komodo just like other project chains. And it also has dPoW through Komodo so its entire blockchain is protected and notarized by bitcoin. Which jl777 mentions makes it the most secure and private blockchain in the world.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> That version of Agama has Pirate support (previously it was only on command lines) and also allows you to mine any currency (including pirate) right from the wallet (if you run the a coin in Native, not lite, and assuming the coin can be mined)
